alert.note: Alert for City of Martinsville; Floyd; Franklin; Henry; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 3:38PM EDT until June 19 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina and Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in north central North Carolina, Rockingham, Stokes and Surry. In Virginia, City of Martinsville, Floyd, Franklin, Henry and Patrick. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 338 PM EDT, While the initial round of showers and storms are exiting the advisory area, urban flooding is occurring in the City of Martinsville. Additional heavy showers and storms are returning to the area. This additional rain could exacerbate the already ongoing flooding situation. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beaver Creek, Belews Creek, Archies Creek, Bassett Branch, Baker Branch, Anglin Branch, Ararat River and Back Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eden... Reidsville... Martinsville... Rocky Mount... Wentworth... Mayodan... Madison... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.

area.areaDesc: City of Martinsville; Floyd; Franklin; Henry; Patrick
